result.execSummary:
All charges against Eugene C. Siekert Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eugene C. Siekert Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eugene C. Siekert Jr.

records.addlTxt: Order for Payment of Attorney Fees

11:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eugene C. Siekert Jr. in court.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Eugene C. Siekert Jr. 
22TR202 tracking with 22CM30:
Atty Zamzow states that the blood results have not been received yet on the traffic ticket.  Atty Juech states that there is a resolution but is in agreement that the blood results are not in.  Atty Zamzow is prepared to proceed today without those results.  

Atty Juech states plea agreement to 22TR202, OWI - 1st offense.  22CM30 to be dismissed.  Atty Zamzow agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  

BY THE COURT:   Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of 22TR202, OWI - 1st offense. 
Pay fine and costs = $937.50
Blood Draw = $50.00
7 month Drivers License Revocation (begin as of June 28, 2022)
AODA and any follow-up treatment 
Repay Attorney fees
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office 

22CM30 to be dismissed

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eugene C. Siekert Jr. in court.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for Eugene C. Siekert Jr. 
22TR202 tracking with 22CM30:
Atty Zamzow does not have an offer yet on the matter; requests another status.  Atty Burdon emailed an offer to Atty Zamzow.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing in person
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:27 AM  Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Eugene C. Siekert in court.
  Defendant did not receive the complaint and just found out that he had a hearing today.    Court confirms address. Court prints a copy of the complaint for the defendant.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to proceed without an attorney.    Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
 *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol
  Status hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
